quizData.question: It is an activity of executing a system or component under specified conditions, observing or recording the results, and evaluating some of the aspects of the system or component.
It is an approach used for detecting defects in software and confirming that requirements are correctly implemented before deploying the software.

Is this Objective of Software Testing Direct or Indirect?
To identify and reveal as many errors as possible in tested software.

Is this Objective of Software Testing Direct or Indirect?
To bring the tested software to an acceptable level of quality after correcting the identified errors and retesting.

Is this Objective of Software Testing Direct or Indirect?
To perform the required tests efficiently and effectively and within the budgetary and scheduling limitations.

Is this Objective of Software Testing Direct or Indirect?
To establish with a degree of confidence that the software package is ready for delivery or installment at customer premises.

Is this Objective of Software Testing Direct or Indirect?
To compile a record of software errors for use in software process improvement by corrective and preventive actions and for decision-making.
Which of the following best describes Unit Testing?
quizData.answer: Performed by the developer on the completed unit or module of the software and before its integration with other modules.
choices: Performed by the developer on the completed unit or module of the software and before its integration with other modules.
The project team performs this type of testing on the integrated systems once all of the individual units work correctly in insolation.
Its objective is to verify that all of the modules and their interfaces work correctly together and to identify and resolve any issues.
Benefits from an existing enterprise architecture that provides information on all existing systems and their alignment with each other.

quizData.answer: Technical tests of the code and require writing test harnesses and creating test data.
choices: Technical tests of the code and require writing test harnesses and creating test data.

Its objective is to verify that all of the modules and their interfaces work correctly together and to identify and resolve any issues.
Benefits from an existing enterprise architecture that provides information on all existing systems and their alignment with each other.

Which of the following best describes System Testing?
quizData.answer: Tests the functionality of an entire system together with interdependencies between system components.
choices: Tests the functionality of an entire system together with interdependencies between system components.

Which of the following best describes Performance Testing?

choices: Its objective is to ensure that the performance of the system is within the bounds specified by the non-functional requirements.

quizData.question: Which of the following best describes Performance Testing?
quizData.answer: May include load performance testing, where the system is subjected to heavy loads over a long period, and stress testing, where the system is subjected to heavy loads during a short time interval.

Which of the following best describes Acceptance Testing?
quizData.answer: System users or customers perform this testing before accepting the product.
choices: System users or customers perform this testing before accepting the product.

quizData.question: Which of the following best describes Acceptance Testing?

choices: The customers will see the product in operation and will determine whether or not the system is fit for purpose.

quizData.question: Which of the following best describes Acceptance Testing?

Testing begins as soon as development activities begin and are carried out in parallel with the development stages. (TR or FL)
The objective of integrating testing to software development process is to find errors at each phrase and prevent these errors from propagating to other phases. (TR or FL)

What Common Phase of the Software Development Process is being described?
Its objective is to evaluate the gathered requirements.

What Common Phase of the Software Development Process is being described?
Each requirement should be evaluated to ensure it's correct and testable, and the requirements together are complete.
What Common Phase of the Software Development Process is being described?

What Common Phase of the Software Development Process is being described?
Software inspections and prototyping can be employed to ensure the good quality of requirements.
What Common Phase of the Software Development Process is being described?

What Common Phase of the Software Development Process is being described?
The activities to perform testing in this phase are to prepare for system testing and requirements analysis activities.

What Common Phase of the Software Development Process is being described?
The test plan should include the scope and objectives for testing at each phase, and the testing requirements should describe support software needed for testing at each stage.

What Common Phase of the Software Development Process is being described?
This phase partitions the requirements into hardware or software systems and builds the overall system architecture.

What Common Phase of the Software Development Process is being described?
Its objective of testing in this phase is to verify the mapping between the requirements specification and the design.

What Common Phase of the Software Development Process is being described?
Any changes to the requirements specification should be reflected in the corresponding design changes.

What Common Phase of the Software Development Process is being described?
Testing at this stage helps to validate the design and interface.

What Common Phase of the Software Development Process is being described?
The activities to perform testing in this phase is to prepare for acceptance and usability testing.

In this phase, the developers start writing and compiling classes and methods.

What Common Phase of the Software Development Process is being described?

What Common Phase of the Software Development Process is being described?
Unit test results and defects should be saved and reported properly for further processing.

What Common Phase of the Software Development Process is being described?
Process of delivering a completed software product to clients.

What Common Phase of the Software Development Process is being described?
Testing activities in this phase is to perform system testing, acceptance testing, and usability testing.

What Common Phase of the Software Development Process is being described?
System testing validates whether the software meets the functional and non-functional requirements, while acceptance testing can be started when the system testing is completed.

What Common Phase of the Software Development Process is being described?
Test cases are derived from acceptance test plans and test data set up.

This is a software artifact with a set of test inputs, execution conditions, and expected results developed for a particular objective, such as to exercise a particular program path to verify compliance with a specific requirement and as documentation for a test item.
This comprise of user inputs that are provided to the application and the procedure for executing the test case during the test.

In the General Test Case Format, what component is being described below?
Name and number to identify a test case.

In the General Test Case Format, what component is being described below?
The reason for the test (may include the type of test).

In the General Test Case Format, what component is being described below?
The activities or steps required on the part of the tester to carry out the test.

In the General Test Case Format, what component is being described below?
Data to enter the system (made up of valid and invalid sets of test data).

In the General Test Case Format, what component is being described below?
Expected results of the test.

In the General Test Case Format, what component is being described below?
Placeholder for recording the actual result as the test case gets executed.

In the General Test Case Format, what component is being described below?
Determines whether the test was a Pass, Fail, or Not Executed.

In the General Test Case Format, what component is being described below?
Any comments on the test case or execution.

In the General Test Case Format, what component is being described below?
May include the name of the tester carrying out the tests, date of execution of the test, the environment in which the test was executed such as hardware and software.
If all tests pass in a Unit Test, the production code in testing is considered to be working - meeting its requirements. (TR or FL)
If even 1 test fails in a Unit Test, the production code is deemed to not meet its requirements. (TR or FL)
In unit testing, test cases are used to evaluate the input and expected output of the unit. (TR or FL)

Which Unit Testing Approach is being described below?
Used to verify the internal logic and program statements of components or software.

Which Unit Testing Approach is being described below?
Involving stepping through every line of code and every branch in the code.

Tester should be knowledgeable in the programming language and should understand the structure of the program to perform this test.

Which Unit Testing Approach is being described below?
This ensures that all program statements and control structures are tested.

Which Unit Testing Approach is being described below?
IDEs contain tools to perform this.

Which Unit Testing Approach is being described below?
The tester derives tests from external descriptions of the software, including specifications, requirements, design.

Which Unit Testing Approach is being described below?
Concerned with the inputs and outputs of the system where a set of input is inserted to the software's UI, and the outputs delivered by the software are compared with the expected outputs.

Tester focuses on whether the class or module meets the requirements stated in the specifications.

Which Unit Testing Approach is being described below?

Open-source unit testing framework for all .NET languages.
This is an iterative process where tests for the code are written before writing the code. It forces the developer to write testable code.
